This event shows the initial expansion of HIV in the D.R.C. (then called Zaire) which occurred around the mid- to late 1950s. The rapid population growth and urbanization in this region created a perfect environment for the virus to disseminate. Additionally, the location near major shipping routes allowed for the virus to be transported globally via infected individuals returning from countries like Haiti, the United States, and Europe.
